thread.title: Up to 10 millimetres of rain expected overnight in southern Quebec
thread.title_full: Up to 10 millimetres of rain expected overnight in southern Quebec

author: cbc
title: Up to 10 millimetres of rain expected overnight in southern Quebec
text:
Southern Quebec can expect snow, ice pellets and freezing rain accumulating on the ground before Wednesday morning's commute.
According to Environment Canada meteorologist Simon Legault, the snow will turn to ice pellets between 6 p.m. and 11 p.m., before switching over to freezing rain
By 6 a.m. Wednesday, southern Quebec can expect between five and 10 millimetres of freezing rain.
"Depending on how the roads are treated tonight, there may be some impact on transportation," Legault said.
After a mild morning, temperatures will dip again with a low of -15 C expected Wednesday evening.
Tonight: Snow then ice pellets or freezing rain then rain. Low rises to 4 C by morning.
Wednesday: Early showers, very windy, then a mix of sun and cloud. Temperature falls to -4 C.
Wednesday night: Windy & a few clouds. Low near -15 C.
Thursday: Mainly sunny. High near -10 C.
Friday: Sunshine, still cold. High near -11 C.
Saturday: Cloudy, light snow. High near -5 C.
Sunday: Mostly cloudy, scattered flurries. High near -1 C.
Montreal moves forward on heated sidewalk project
